item.title: Tim Cook Rallies the Team
item.description:
Tim Cook Rallies the Team

In the days following Apple's record Q1 earnings announcements, Apple CEO Tim Cook and other top Apple executives held a Town Hall meeting at the Infinite Loop headquarters in Cupertino to reveal new announcements and take attendee questions.

item.title: The Compensation of Jony Ive
item.description:
The Compensation of Jony Ive

Judging by the headlines it generated, the biggest news in the proxy statement Apple filed with the Securities Exchange Commission Wednesday was the $25 million compensation package awarded five Apple executives in fiscal 2015: Luca Maestri (chief financial officer), Angela Ahrendts (retail), Eddy Cue (digital content), Don Riccio (hardware), and Bruce Sewell (legal).

item.title: Tim Cook Leading on Privacy
item.description:
Tim Cook Leading on Privacy

By: Mikey Campbell As expected, Apple CEO Tim Cook urged White House and government officials to come to terms with strong encryption practices that protect consumer data, at one point saying such intentions should be stated publicly.

item.title: Tim Cook on 60 Minutes
item.description:
Tim Cook on 60 Minutes

The following is a script from "Inside Apple" which aired on Dec. 20, 2015. Charlie Rose is the correspondent. Michael Radutzky, Andrew Bast and Glen Rochkind, producers.

item.title: Tom Cotton takes on TimCook
item.description:
Tom Cotton takes on TimCook

By: Roger Fingas In a statement issued on Monday, U.S. Senator Tom Cotton, a Republican from Arkansas, criticized Tim Cook for his defense of strong encryption during a 60 Minutes interview, claiming that the Apple CEO had "omitted critical facts."

item.title: Hello World, I believe in Apple.
item.description:
Hello World, I believe in Apple.

My name is Scott Greer and I am a PhD student at Alliant International University. I am studying the concept of leadership and I am fascinated and intrigued by Apple. Because of this and my desire to tie my work to something that interests me, I have decided to look at different events and leadership decisions with Apple using academic models and concepts.Â
